alert.note: Alert for Calumet; Manitowoc (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 5:53PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Calumet and Manitowoc Counties through 630 PM CDT... At 551 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Little Chute to near Valders to 11 miles east of Cleveland. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Valders around 610 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include St. Nazianz, Manitowoc, High Cliff State Park, Brillion, Cleveland, Northern Lake Winnebago and Camp Rokilio Scout Camp. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A quick inch of rain in under 30 minutes is possible.
